title: Deer Species Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of the graceful deer family, from majestic elk to tiny muntjacs

questions.question: Which member of the deer family is the largest, with males weighing up to 1,800 pounds and sporting massive palmate antlers?
Which is the only deer species in which both males and females grow antlers?
What is a male deer typically called?
Which deer species is the most common in North America and is known for raising its white tail as an alarm signal?
Which large North American deer has a distinctive bugling call during the autumn mating season?
Which small Asian deer has tusks (elongated canine teeth) instead of antlers?
Which European deer has a spotted coat in summer and is commonly kept in deer parks?
What is the soft, velvet-like covering on growing deer antlers called?
Which tiny deer from Southeast Asia is one of the smallest hoofed mammals, standing only about 12 inches tall?
Which deer species is domesticated by the Sami people of northern Scandinavia and used for pulling sleds?
Which South American deer is the smallest deer species in the world, standing only about 13 inches at the shoulder?
Which North American deer gets its name from its large, mule-like ears?
How often do most male deer shed and regrow their antlers?
Which deer, now found wild in parts of England, was originally native to East Asia and has a spotted coat and distinctive bark-like call?
Which extinct Irish deer, also known as the Irish Elk, had the largest antlers of any known deer, spanning up to 12 feet?
